page.title: 01St. Levan Parish, Cornwall.
page.content: St. Levan is a diamond shaped parish on the coast of Cornwall south of Land's End. The people get their living from dairy/mixed{farming}helped by{tourism}in the summer. A few fish. {Porthcurno is known internationally as a telegraph station, with undersea cables, once used the local beach. An advanced communications school keeps this little valley on the world map. {The Minack Theatre,}in a unique cliff setting, was created by Miss Rowena Cade. Known world wide in its own way, it is hugely popular on fine summer evenings.{500+ people can enjoy eating {picnics in their seats before watching {performances of all theatrical tastes. The granite cliffs are renowned for their landscape splendour, but they are hazardous.{Many ships were wrecked on these coasts in the past and this is still a real danger.
